name: Dundalk Chamber of Commerce
goal:
The organisation was set up to allow businesses to network. It also lobies local and national government on policy matters relevant to its mebers.
It is involved in encoraging cross border trade, social and other contacts with Northern Ireland.
It works with schools to allow students develop an understanding of opportunities and to experience real practical work experience.
The Chamber works with other volutary organisations to raise awarness of worthwhile causes.
The cChamber assists in or runs Festivals including St Patrick's day.
It supports training for its members and the wider community
interests: Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Fraud prevention, International co-operation and development, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Single market, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
InterReg; Peace 4;and BREXIT.

We are the townclosest to the border on the M1 less than 10km from Northern Ireland.
